alert.note: Alert for Crosby; Garza; Lubbock; Lynn (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lubbock (Lubbock and South Plains Texas)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 01 at 11:31AM CDT by NWS Lubbock
info.description: ...A cluster of strong thunderstorms with torrential rainfall will impact portions of southern Lubbock, Lynn, Garza and southern Crosby Counties through NOON CDT... At 1129 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a cluster of strong thunderstorms centered about 8 miles northeast of Tahoka, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Lubbock, Slaton, Post, Tahoka, Wolfforth, Ransom Canyon, O`Donnell, Kalgary, Grassland, New Moore, Lubbock South Plains Mall, Justiceburg, Caprock, Texas Tech University, Southland, Slide, Downtown Lubbock, Woodrow, Reese Center and Wilson. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
